Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel in Central London”
Reviews.Author: wflbigwood_123
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a real find. We have seldom had such good service even in much more excpensive hotels. the room we had, although some might have found it small, was extremely comfortable and well equipped. The staff at Reception were most helpful and the restaurant, which we had not really intended to use, turned out to be good, very reasonable in price and with very charming staff and particularly welcome after whole days of researching in London libraries because it meant that we did not need to starty searching for a restaurant when we came in in the evening.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Wmm115
Reviews.Content: Great location...excellent service & gd value for money when compared with other central London hotels of the same standard. On a negative note.. Room 104 is really very small, don't know if all rooms are the same size or not. Suitcases did not even fit inside room having to leave same in passageway next to bed. Also the housecoat was very dirty and stained on arrival. It was however replaced immediately after advising reception. On the whole Thumbs Up...and I hope they keep this standard and gd pricing for years to come.

Reviews.Title: “All we want from a hotel”
Reviews.Author: mikansoo
Reviews.Content: Where to start with this wonderful hotel? I guess the first, although not the most important, thing is its central location – an easy 5 minute stroll from Marble Arch tube station and close to many of London’s attractions and theatres. Next, the building itself: on our first visit about 18 months ago it was undergoing renovation. This has now been completed and although the main structure is obviously old, once inside the décor is modern and tasteful with an air of quiet opulence. The public areas and the bedrooms are immaculately clean and in the bathroom we appreciated hot water without the long wait you get in some older buildings. The air conditioning is unobtrusive and, with a room to the rear of the hotel, we were able to open the sash window without too much traffic noise. The only small complaint is that because the hotel is a conversion from a private house some rooms are rather undersized and in No 405 it was impossible to sit comfortably on the dressing table chair as the bed was too close. But, Hey! Who cares – we just sat on the bed to use the mirror. We had afternoon tea on our first day as we had arranged to meet some family there. Our recommendation is to order one portion for every two people – any more and you’ll be asking for a doggy bag. Similarly breakfast provides enough volume and variety to keep you going all day. Regretfully our schedules have never allowed time to visit either of the restaurants for dinner but we hope to do so on a future stay. We did, however, have a bar meal on our first night and this did not disappoint. Now to the most important element of any hotel stay – the staff. The welcome is warm, cheerful and efficient; the domestic staff are similarly cheerful and professional as are the bartenders and waiters/waitresses. We reckon a good hotel keeps its staff and we recognised many of the faces from our previous visit. More importantly, the faces recognised us and their warm greetings and attentive service made us feel so at home. On our second and last night we saw The Wizard of Oz – a magical experience – and our whole visit was made magical by our stay at the Mostyn. There is now no other hotel for us when we visit London.

Reviews.Title: “Happy of Hythe”
Reviews.Author: tidemarks_9
Reviews.Content: Have just booked a break at this hotel and am really amazed at the service and help I received from the Reservations man, Nihal, Can't wait to get there.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely handy hotel”
Reviews.Author: stonker
Reviews.Content: I spent 2 nights here in october 2011 half term with my teenage son. The hotel was really nice the staff were friendly and very helpful and the breakfast was great. Very close to Hyde Park and Oxford Street is 2 mins away. We went to the Palladium to see Wizard of Oz which was within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Marvellous Mostyn”
Reviews.Author: AllyUK_11
Reviews.Content: Yet again our stay at the Mostyn was marvellous. Rooms were clean and well maintained with good facilities. They always provide you with a bottle of water and two chocolates on the bed which is a nice touch. Breakfast was very good and we had an excellent evening meal there as well. The staff were as friendly and efficient as ever. The location is excellent as the main bus routes and Marble Arch tube station are nearby. The Three Tuns pub over the road is definitely worth a visit. We can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid room 119”
Reviews.Author: john r
Reviews.Content: Booked two rooms in this Hotel, both Club rooms, so breakfast included ( not worth the Â£20 per person they charge outside of this offer) and a free drink each evening between 6pm and 7pm, good touch as you could order anything at all. The bedrooms,one twin room for daughter and son room 118, large room, twin beds, compact en-suite. Our room, next door room number 119 - a tiny 11 ft x 9ft. Take into account a comfy 5ft bed, with a desk and chair at the end gave around 2 ft to get past to a very small ensuite with shower over bath and no room whatsoever to put even a toiletries bag. Now I understand it is London and space is a premium but this was taking the Michael, believe me. I couldn't even take a photo to put on here as it was so small! Air con / heating system, no instructions at all in both rooms. Room was either very hot or cold, no inbetween, kids room only blew cold air. Now take into account in our room, a large sash window, very poor double glazing, a delivery wagon every morning at roughly 2.45 am banging, crashing trolleys on and off the wagon deliverying and collecting linen and towels to the Thistle Hotel opposite for an hour each morning, then you realise you are going to have an interrupted sleep. Sort out the glazing and make this a single room. Big disappointment, wrote a note on the first morning addressed to Duty Manager and / or yours truly James Jude but nobody replied whilst we where staying, still no response despite Receptionist making notes and assuring us someone would be in touch within 48 hours, been home a week now and not heard from anyone? I am sure James Jude will reply on here to this ? Anyway, Hotel itself is well decorated and clean, including the bedrooms. Staff were fine and helpful. Bottled water is in each bedroom as they advise not to drink the tapwater in the bathrooms. There is also a fridge in each bedroom to keep your drinks chilled and a little ice cube tray. Location is great, we tried Golden Dragon chinese restaurant in China Town as recommended by the Concierge and would recommend that. Would not go back unless guaranteed a decent size room with triple glazed windows. Be aware when booking direct as we did, the price you see does NOT include VAT and the likes of Laterooms does work out cheaper.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay and brilliant staff”
Reviews.Author: jpbarthet
Reviews.Content: Even though it was s short stay, i really enjoyed this city hotel right in the centre of London. The hotel is refurbished in style, everything you would expect is present, and most important of all the staff are very welcoming from the very minute you step into the hotel. Especially their concierge Maroun ... simply excellent!!

Reviews.Title: “highly recommend”
Reviews.Author: tahelbp
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a lovely trip to London. The Mostyn Hotel was a very welcome surprise. The room was newly renovated and clean, with complimentary bottled water, chocolate and cookies brought to our room every day. The reception staff was polite and professional (especially Ray, the concierge). The breakfast was good with a nice variety. Free Wifi throughout the hotel, including the rooms, is an added bonus. In short, we highly recommend this hotel for your stay in London

Reviews.Title: “Small but nice”
Reviews.Author: Arni_Jon
Reviews.Content: Stayed almost a week there and I have little to complain about, but only the price of the breakfast. The rooms were small but nice and the WiFi was tolerable, staff was friendly and helpful so there is quite little to complain. The average price pr. night was tolerable and The Marbel Arch tube station was quite close. All in all a nice stay at a nice place but they should think about the price of a breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Happy to have found quality and good value.”
Reviews.Author: TrevisoBettiol
Reviews.Content: Checked in here after having had a horrid experience at the nearby Gloucester Place Hotel. It's lovely on all counts!

Reviews.Title: “The best ever”
Reviews.Author: ehandjh
Reviews.Content: Stayed Thursday to Sunday-Wonderful hotel and staff. Everyone- the receptionist, the concierge, restaurant and bar staff all went that bit further to make our stay a real pleasure. The room was clean, well appointed and for London fairly large. Nothing was too much trouble. Will stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel with excellent location”
Reviews.Author: POLINA2006
Reviews.Content: We have booked an other hotel in central london but as soon as we arrived we realised it was not livable. So we visited Mostyn Hotel and after we found out they had one available room and the price was reasonable we booked it. We loved the hotel, especially the location. One minute from Oxford str., two minutes from Marble Arch tube station. The breakfast was great. The staff was very helpful. A great pub is one minute from hotel, and also a Costa coffee on the corner opposite. What more does a traveller need? I recommend this hotel !!!

Reviews.Title: “One Night Stay”
Reviews.Author: Neil L
Reviews.Content: Thoroughly enjoyed my stay and I had to find a hotel in the Marble Arch area owing to a visit planned at the US Embassy in Grosvenor Square. The hotel was only 5-10 minutes walk away from the Embassy and I found this after a web search which brought up several contenders. I picked this hotel because of the location and the accomodation on offer but mainly because they did a special offer at about 60% of the advertsied room rate. Breakfast was extra but this was very good and reasonable value. The hotel accomodation is superb and it looks like there has been a major refurbishment recently as the rooms are decorated, furnished and equippped to a very high standard. Only one minor issue with the TV but apart from that for a one night stay with this was perfect for me. For business travellers the WIFI worked well without any hassle and there is also a wired Ethernet connection as you would expect. I highly rate this hotel and will be going back at the next opportunity if the same deal is on offer again.

Reviews.Title: “Nicely refurbished”
Reviews.Author: salvinoF
Reviews.Content: Have revisited this Hotel and found out it was nicely refurbished, the staff are very friendly and helpfull. One thing which I did not like is the motor engine hearing from our room No.329 which goes on even during the night. Your also can enjoy free WIFI in the room and in the lobby etc.

Reviews.Title: “Close to Oxford st”
Reviews.Author: tinkerbell133
Reviews.Content: Lovely clean hotel friendly and helpful staff. Arrived an hour early but was able to go to our room. Lovely large bath sheets with ample toilettries, over head shower. Good quality heavy blackout curtains, decent size t.v with sky. Again ample supply of tea and coffee also hot chocolate and biscuits in the room with bottled water. Bed very comfortable like sleeping in a marshmallow. only stayed over night but could easily have stayed longer. Nice size room. Literally a road away from Oxford st so an ideal place to stay for shopping. We were in the basement by the road so there was a little noise from the traffic above but nothing major and apart from the usual closing of doors from other hotel users there was no other noise. The down side is that there is no parking but across the rd is a car park where you can park for 24hrs (maybe longer) which was ideal. Cost of car park was Â£36 for 24hrs. A bit pricey but because of location we could just walk everywhere. So parked up and left the car until it was time to leave. English Breakfast expensive at Â£19 each although i believe your key card gives you a 15% discount but still expensive. There are other options for breakfast that are less expensive. Did not have any meals in the hotel so unable to comment. Would definately stay here again. Stayed across the road a few years ago at the Thistle but the rooms are not a patch on Best Western.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Kristin M
Reviews.Content: I picked this hotel for a two nights stay with my 15 year old son because of it's location. Of course, the club deal sounded nice as well, but due to various reviews I was a bit sceptical. Not anymore! Nice, polite and helpful staff. A bit small room, but the beds was comfy and there even was a pillow menu. In spite of room in first floor facing street, we were not bothered with traffic noise at all. Bathrobes, slippers, teamaker, complimentary drinks, newspaper and breakfast. Everything we were told to expect upon booking was available. Clean room, and wonderful bath towels. The hot selection of the breakfast was nice. The cold selection could use a little improvement. Tasty croissants, but the cheese and sliced fruits looked like leftovers from yesterday. At check out, the consierge made our day. He used a scale and told us exactely how far we were from the airlines weight limit. Then he stored our luggage and gave us good advice on how to get to the airport and when we should go there to arrive in time. Two minor negativities: The wifi didn't work very well in our room, but it was possible to connect by cable so we survived, and the bedside lamps were not really useful as reading light. The lamps were too low and didn't provide enough light. But after a full day in the streets of London, who wants to read anyway? Best Western Mostyn is good value for money, provides a good night sleep and have a great location. I will definately stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location and value package”
Reviews.Author: winerunner52
Reviews.Content: Stayed two nights in Club Room. If you arrive with your own car Club room is good package as it includes full (english) breakfast and parking in multi-storey car park opposite hotel. Room was compact/cosy but was comfortable, modern and clean. On first floor, noise from the street not a real problem - this is in Central London after all. 2 minute walk to Oxford Street - Primark or Selfridges depending on your wallet! Front Desk - friendly helpful and efficient. Breakfast - good choice and staff coped well with a busy spell. Would highly recommend and would use again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice...”
Reviews.Author: kalupukka
Reviews.Content: Nice place and surroundings. Parking is available at local car parks. Food good. Nice ambience in the bar. Room standards good.

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel in an super location”
Reviews.Author: MIRI
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel a few years ago and I would definitely stay there again. The location couldn't be better, staff was great and so was the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great all round; location, service and rooms.”
Reviews.Author: OliviaB19
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night on business. Great service when checking in and throughout our stay. Great location just of Oxford Street near Selfridges. Rooms are really nice, cosy and clean with a lovely bathroom, massive shower. The hotel clearly is trying to make a positive impact regarding environmental issues which was good. We didn't stay for breakfast as it was quite expensive. I will be booking this hotel again next time I am in the capital and would definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Just the ticket”
Reviews.Author: abigailherron
Reviews.Content: Lovely rooms, friendly reception staff, a delightful concierge and a great location. Iâ€™d like to see more vegetarian options on the in house restaurants but aside from that, this is a hotel I will return to again and again.

Reviews.Title: “FAN-TA-STIC HOTEL!!!”
Reviews.Author: wastoroua
Reviews.Content: We stayed in London for three nights after our honeymoon trip in USA, on our way back to Cyprus, and i have to say that i was totally amazed with how beautiful and cozy this hotel is!!! First of all, you could not ask for a more central location, its behind Oxford street, very close to the Marble Arch station , 1 minute walk away from Primark store!!! The transportation was very easy to/from the hotel, with buses stopping almost outside the hotel, and at night too! Secondly, we were totally amazed at the hotel, it was GREAT! Usually when you hear London hotels, everybody says that they are not spacious, clean, or modern, and that they are extremely pricey. Yes, this hotel IS pricey, but you get to stay at an amazing, clean, beautiful hotel, in a very nice, location! The rooms were extremely nice, spacious, and spotless clean! Even my husband who is biased with London hotels says that it is one of the nicest hotels, especially in a busy city like London! Would definitely recommend this hotel, and i hope that we will be able to stay again when we visit London!

Reviews.Title: “Lovley hotel greeting let it down a little!”
Reviews.Author: Frankham11
Reviews.Content: As we arrived after a hectic drive through London we were welcomed with an unfriendly receptionist whom had she simply smiled and appeared interested in us would have made our visit outstanding! The room was fantastic and modern with a very comfy bed and the location brilliant. Just need cheerier staff as when paying a quite expensive bill it's the least you should expect!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good price”
Reviews.Author: comfyzone
Reviews.Content: We booked for a pre- xmas chill out, leisurely visiting xmas events, hotel 2 mins from Hyde Park Winter Wonderland which was fantastic, hotel was spotlessly clean, beds soooo comfy, polite staff, would stay again

Reviews.Title: “FAULTLESS .......”
Reviews.Author: Lindylou123_11
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a 2 night long weekend break with son and found the hotel ideally located for everything from sightseeing, underground connections, theatre shows and heaven for shopaholics as you couldn't be nearer to the hustle and bustle of Oxford Street shops. The hotel was immaculately clean, staff were so obliging, courteous and friendly and any requests where met without hesitation. I would highly highly recommend this hotel, the breakfast was superb both mornings and very efficient and friendly staff made for a wonderful stay. We had a family room which was decorated first class, immaculately clean and everythiing to hand, wanted for nothing, everything catered for. A credit to the Best Western chain .......... THANK YOU

Reviews.Title: “Good service, good location, fair price for London”
Reviews.Author: iainkshama
Reviews.Content: A quick business trip necessitating an overnight stay: our usual Corporate rate hotels were all fully booked, so this was a last minute "find". Better than the usual corporate/business hotel, good rooms, well equipped bathrooms, extremely friendly (but not ingratiatingly so), helpful and efficient staff, good public rooms, very good breakfast: all that one could want. I shall use it again!

Reviews.Title: “Smart Hotel in a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Euphoricandy
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on business and was a bit nervous as I don't usually like Best Western Hotels. However, this one was different to any other BW i'd stayed in before. Firstly, the location is excellent. It is walking distance from Paddington Station and only a stones throw from Oxford Street. The rooms are very modern and have some neat features like a speaker in the bathroom so you can listen to the TV whilst having a shower. If you like contemporary styling, then this hotel will be right up your street. We used the Brynston conference room and found it to be very comfortable. It was a lovely big room with very high ceilings. Breakfast was average and what you'd expect in this kind of hotel. Overall, a very good experience!

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded my expectations!”
Reviews.Author: rem123sa
Reviews.Content: I have traveled to London many times in the last 35 years - my requirements for hotels have been good location (or close to a tube stop), safe area, and clean rooms. This trip was different, decided to upgrade my choice of locations and hotels, because it was a special trip with my daughter. What a great hotel! The staff always were always helpful, the services offered were more than satisfactory. The room was small compared to american hotel rooms but much larger than alot of the hotel rooms I have stayed in in London, and my daughter and I were very comfortable with the room and beautiful bath. Breakfast was included in our package - a wonderful meal - never had to wait to be seated and the servers went out of their way to make sure we were satisfied with our meal. Every evening we enjoyed a cocktail in the lobby bar - again great service. We were helped with information on plays, art exhibits and transportation. I plan to stay at this hotel again - one and a half blocks from the Marble Arch Tube station, Hyde Park, great shopping opportunities. One block behind the hotel were several restaurants we enjoyed - especially the Grazing Goat Pub. I highly recommend this hotel for its localtion, nice rooms but MOST of all for its outstanding SERVICE!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent in every way!”
Reviews.Author: Aiobhinn
Reviews.Content: Just returned from my second stay here. It was just as good this time round. The staff were friendly and helpful and the room was lovely. The rooms aren't very spacious but for a short stay they are fine. The hotel is located just off Oxford Street and is so handy for shopping, sightseeing or theatre. What I really liked both times was how quiet the hotel was at night. For such a central hotel I imagined it to be very noisy but there wasn't a sound! I would highly recommend this hotel. It is a bit more pricey than other hotels but it is worth it for the convenience and comfort.

Reviews.Title: “A tad overpriced, great location but restaurant too small - asked to leave bfast early so they could seat 12 waiting !”
Reviews.Author: TeenagersDad
Reviews.Content: Booked this for a business trip but right on the footsteps of Oxford Street and Park Lane 100 metres from Marble Arch, so I can see why popular with shopping tourists. Had 1st Floor room near lifts and moved as too nosiy and chnaged to room 401, through small was tanquil quiet with ability to open window a little ! Well appointed room, though small was ok for single. Bfast was very disappointing, had to wait 5 minutes to get seated then after rushed bfast asked to leave before I had finsihed my 2nd cup of tea as many couples still waiting outside the restaurant. For Â£200 a night that is not on and undermined the stay. HINT: 1) Get a room in the "Court yard" as quieter. 2) The Higher the quieter and away from busy lifts. 3) Ask what time the bfast will be quietest 4) Internet access was slow but free. 5) If you want real bargains, get train from Marylebone to BIcester (35 min by comfortable train)and there go to Bicester Village (google it) all the big brands have discount shops there. The teenagers love it and savvy repeat London vistiors always seem to make a bee line for it.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff & good location...”
Reviews.Author: MariaN75017
Reviews.Content: It's always a pleasure to stay in this hotel with its helpful & friendly staff -- this is my 9th stay. Location is easily accessible by tube/buses which makes it convenient to visit london's landmarks and also great for shopping at oxford street/marble arch area.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in the centre of London”
Reviews.Author: Rikki_Tikki_Tavi_43
Reviews.Content: Traveled to London with three kids and stayed for three nights. The rooms were better than expected, both the beds and the bathroom. Sleep very well during the stay. The restaurant is placed in the basement and it was okey for breakfast but I suggest that you take the dinner somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Our fifth stay.”
Reviews.Author: RandiDI
Reviews.Content: Fabulous location just a short block from Oxford St. & The Marble Arch. The rooms have all been renovated, & although not posh, very comfortable with very nice washrooms. The staff are all very friendly & helpful. They recognized me from four months earlier & welcomed my return. The breakfast room is pleasant & the food is good & fresh. I hope to return over & over again.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable luxuary at a prime location.”
Reviews.Author: NatB1982
Reviews.Content: The hotel is clean, friendly and very well presented. The little extras in the room, like the toiletries, complimentary large bottle of water, complimentary Sunday Newspaper, and a mini fridge were brilliant unexpected extras which made the stay all the more comfortable. Despite only being a few seconds away from Oxford Street, the room was quiet. It was also light and airy, and a nice, decent size. Not cramped like some of the other London hotels I've stayed in have been. The air con worked a treat, and the bathroom is modern and clean. The bed and bedding were very comfortable, and the curtains were of a decent quality which, when fully drawn blocked out all outside light, which is important as the hotel room had 2 wonderfully large sized windows. The breakfast was one of the best I have sampled in a hotel. There was a good selection of cereals, fruit and continental items. There is also the option for cooked items, such as boiled eggs, scrambled eggs on toast, but the option I chose both mornings was the fully cooked English breakfast, cooked fresh when ordered, it was totally yummy and a must for a full day ahead! The restaurant where breakfast is served in is of a nice size, not too big, and clean with a nice ambiance. The times for breakfast during our stay, which was during a weekend were very thoughtful and considerate. Breakfast is served from 8am - 11am, which is early enough for eager explorers, but allows people to have a lie-in should they wish to. I totally recommend this hotel, and plan to return myself in the next few months.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel very good location”
Reviews.Author: perla010
Reviews.Content: spent a week with my daughter at this hotel and we had a great time. the location cannot be better, the room was big and quiet, staff very polite and helpful. will come back next time.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, not so friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: LuliLUL
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 3 nights. We arrived at 15:00 and we ask the concierge what does he recommends to do in the next hours. He gave us a map of the tourist buses and said we should take the tour. When we told him that we are not interested he wasn't helpful. The same thing was when we ask for recommendation on a good restaurant around the hotel. He just said that there are lots of restaurant around. His behavior seemed weird but we thought that maybe he doesnâ€™t know a lot. But then we saw that he is very friendly and cooperative with other guest and finally after we heard him speak Arabic we understood what the problem was - we are from Israel and probably this guy doesnâ€™t like Israelis. What a shame! After that we had some issue to deal with our invitation. The manger wasn't very polite, to say the least, and she barely let me speak. She interrupted me every time i protested her and finally I told her that I didnâ€™t expect this kind of treatment in a 4 star Hotel! the other staff were friendly and helpful. on the other hand - the hotel is in perfect location: near the Marbel Arch station (central line) and its clean and nice. The breakfast was not good enough and very poor. There are some coffee shops near by so I recommend eating there and save your money.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay in good location”
Reviews.Author: Kaisa K
Reviews.Content: - Nice room, VERY comfy beds. The room looked like it had been newly renovated. - Very friendly staff, especially the congierges. - Just a 2 minutes walk from the Marble Arch undergroud station - There was a draft from the window, but the heavy curtains block most of it. But hey, this is the UK, what do you expect, they don't know anything about insulation ;-) - The free WLAN signal was very weak in the room, the ethernet worked fine.

Reviews.Title: “Central Location, Pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: Mikebren12
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on the 27th October for 3 nights, 1st impressions were very good, the concierge was very welcoming and friendly. We got there some 5 hours before check-in, and the hotel staff were only to happy to take our bags until we returned later in the day. The hotel is very clean and the reception area is very modern. There is a bar area just past the reception with rest rooms on the same floor. The concierge is extremely helpful, from organising taxi's, to tourist info and in general just a friendly welcoming smile every time you came into view. Our rooms were on the 4th floor, and although a touch on the small side were comfortable and clean. Breakfast is on the lower ground floor with a good choice from Full English to fruit and yoghurts with pastries also available. Tea, coffee and juices are readily available, and top ups available as and when required. A tip though I'd book the including breakfast price as Â£20 per person can shrink even the most full of wallets. (Which is what we had done). This hotel is situated parallel to Oxford Street about 50 yds behind and a two minute walk to Marble arch underground station. Selfridges is 5 mins the other way, so central for London shopping districts. Most places are reached quickly and easily from this area via the underground. I would recommend this hotel and will certainly be using again on our next visit to London.

Reviews.Title: “Nice staff but noisy hotel”
Reviews.Author: jjve6759
Reviews.Content: We were a party of three and had two rooms, 114, which is a club room on the 1st floor, and 320 an executive room on the 3rd floor, staying for five nights from the 27th October. Extremly nice personnel, bit the front office, restaurant, porters etc. The management should be proud to have these persons working for them. The hotel is clean, actually spotless. But the rooms, well that is another story. Anybody staying in this hotel should avoid room 114. The decor is nice but the traffic noise from the street and the size practically ruined our stay. Enough to say that I snubbed my toe twice whilst walking to the bathroom and 'trying' to somehow wiggle myself between the bed and the writing desk. The odd thing is that room 320 on the 3rd floor basically has the same decor and size but at least it is not in the least noisy and it costs far less than the club room 114.

Reviews.Title: “Gem of a hotel in central London”
Reviews.Author: Bev95
Reviews.Content: As a party of 4 adults, we stayed at this hotel for 3 nights (27th - 30th Oct 2011). Apart from our rooms been slightly on the small side, we have no complaints at all. The staff were very friendly and professional. We all found the breakfast menu to be very good. The overall ambience, experience and cleanliness of this hotel was excellent and truly demonstrated value for money. The hotel is very close to Oxford Street and the tube station (Marble Arch) a 2 minute walk away. We do travel a lot and we are fairly fussy about where we stay....but we would make no hesitation in recommending this hotel as an excellent place to stay in central London. It was spotlessly clean and had a very contemporaneous and elegant feel. Thankyou!

Reviews.Title: “Compact, but clean and convenient”
Reviews.Author: Bobs_head
Reviews.Content: Shopping trip to London - so this hotel is perfect in terms of location. Very close to Oxford St and easy to drop bags off! Was staying on my own, so had a very small single room, but it was clean and had quite obviously been recently refurbished. The bathroom was lovely, nice and bright with a large open shower unit (no bath, which didn't bother me). Staff were great and very helpful, I can't really fault this hotel apart from the size of the room! Very good indeed.

Reviews.Title: “really nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: tog3878
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights-really nice bedroom Friendly attentive staff Excellent position -very near Marble Arch Tube station yet quietly located up from Oxford Street. Happy to recommend and will stay here again the next time we visit London. An Oyster card makes for easy travel around. If you come by train there are numerous "2 for1" on production of your rail ticket Tower of London, Lords tour etc -worth checking out

Reviews.Title: “"Good base for central London"”
Reviews.Author: Amanda S
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights we found the staff helpful and welcoming. The hotel was very clean the room was well equipped for our short stay.The breakfast was fine with an adequate selection of food. We did use the Fire and Spice restaurant and had excellent service and a lovely meal before going to the theatre. We will use this hotel again as we found ideally based to get around London and it was also easily reached from Paddington Station.

Reviews.Title: “A nice hotel for a weekend”
Reviews.Author: bobabout1959
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights in a standard double room. The staff were very nice and friendly, the room was reasonable for central London - well equipped though its was on the small side. The air con was good to have and though we overlooked the road there was very little noise. Breakfast was good for this type of hotel. All the public rooms appeared to be well presented and the level of decoration was good. A few things to consider: There is one lift as far as I could see for the hotel , so you may be waiting at busy times. The corridor to the rooms was narrow and had stairs in a place I didn't expect. The breakfast room was on the small side and though we didn't have to wait, I noticed other guests queuing for tables as we left the room.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and welcoming staff”
Reviews.Author: SussexBibi
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a very good overnight stay at the Mostyn where we found the staff very welcoming and the hotel very clean. The check in process was fast and painless which was good as we had to move swiftly on to see the Phantom of the Opera! On our return I was about to run a bath when I found there was no bath plug - a lovely chap from the concierge desk, Raynard, tried to find another plug but none would fit so he moved us to a great new room ... Raynard dealt with the whole situation in a very friendly and professional way - this guy should be promoted!. The breakfast was very good and again the staff were efficient and friendly.The hotel is located just behind Oxford Street and just a stone's throw from Selfridges!

Reviews.Title: “Little gem in the heart of London”
Reviews.Author: chefdave
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for three nights in September, check in smooth and offered a cold drink on arrival. Booked a club room very comfortable and although at the front of the hotel surprisingly very quiet considering you are in the centre of London. Breakfast very good with hot items cooked to order and very efficient staff. Would definitely stay again as it is in a great location and close to tube (Marble Arch) and in walking distance to most attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Maybe we were just unlucky”
Reviews.Author: 1Johnw1
Reviews.Content: 5 night stay and we were moved to 4 different rooms! Room1: nice room but a generator running throughout the night outside our window meant we could not sleep so asked for a move. Room 2: no noise, but smaller room, also air conditioning controls did not work, but decided to put up with this as it could be turned off/ on at reception. However When we used the shower we discovered a significant leak from below the shower tray which flooded the whole bathroom floor within a minute of use. Hotel could not fix this or the air con problem so moved us again. Room 3: larger room than room 2 but on lower ground level which meant reduced natural light coming into the room, decided to stay here as fed up packing and unpacking every day to move. Had full night in this room, but at 17.00 the next night all electrics in the room failed, no lights or no power. We reported this and the concierge appeared very quickly but was unable to fix the problem. We had to leave him to it as we had to attend the theatre. On our return At 23.00 the lights were fixed, but no small power, TV or kettle available. Hotel could not fix this so moved yet again. Room 4: Similar room to room 3 on lower ground floor (reduced natural light) but at least this was our last move. Even this room had minor irritations, broken toilet seat and noise from the gym next door when it was in use, but by this time we were fed up complaining and decided to put up with it. Also During our 5 night visit the free wifi advertised was never available we aked about this and were merely told an engineer had been called, but no promises of when it would be fixed. This could be a good hotel, due to location and it appears to have been recently refurbished, the breakfast each morning was also very good. Shame about how the management were unable to react to the problems with our rooms... Maybe we were just unlucky.

Reviews.Title: “One Night Only!”
Reviews.Author: Karen A
Reviews.Content: Can't fault this hotel, only stayed for 1 night, but had a lovely room, very comfortable bed, fab shower! Great service & very clean.

Reviews.Title: “Really good location but lousy staff , dun expect service .. Ridiculous concierge.”
Reviews.Author: Nahnahland
Reviews.Content: The conceirge was extremely money hungry . Before you can react to them finishing moving the luggages , they actually stretch their palms to you . How ridiculous. We even tried to be friendly and realize each extra service they offer , it would be expected to have payment . I understand and practise tipping but this kind of behavior is unacceptable . I stayed at radisson edwardian sussex once and the service was so professional. On the other hand , the conceirge who is a smaller built black guy is the most horrible. He certainly nade our 10 days stay uncomfortable . By the way this is also the only hotel that does not provide complimentary late checkout if room is available in so many hotel I have been all over the world. The front desk also was not very courteous when they replied my request of late checkout, it could have been :"madam , we do not offer complementtary late checkout unfortunately" instead of "you can late checkout , either 25Â£ per hour or 75Â£ till 6 pm . " . The hotel is the only hotel in the world that charge for storing luggage at concierge till 6pm. This is ridiculous . If you have document to print ,do not think that they can help provide chargeable service for printing . They only offer business center at 10Â£ for a fixed time no other alternative was given. The last time I stayed in Edwardian , they help print , help even store my package and send it to courier . One of my fern left her neck pillow in the room in Radisson Edwardian , and the staff even send it bk to Singapore at no charge insisting that this is their service . I seriously would nt recommend friends , family , or even netizens to go there .

Reviews.Title: “Nice and cozy in the Middle of the London”
Reviews.Author: Nata78
Reviews.Content: Hotel has a central location. You will be able to get everywhere in a very short time. Service in the hotel is very nice. Staff are friendly and you will also get service in russian if needed. This is a huge value for russian tourists. Rooms are small, but cosy and nice. Breakfast is very poor :(

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: essuu
Reviews.Content: I spent two nights at the Mostyn Hotel, on a midweek break. The location is excellent being just off Oxford Street and no more than 2 minutes walk to Marble Arch Tube Station. Upon arrival I was asked if I wanted a quiet room and was given a room (401),which seemed to be separate from the other rooms on the other side of a staircase. If you wish for a quiet room I would highly recommend you ask for this one. The room itself was well laid out and was a reasonable size although not large. It is well equipped with mini safe, iron and board, tea/coffee making facility. Also a flat screen TV, the only issue was every time you opened the wardrobe the door hit the TV. All parts of the hotel are very clean and the staff were always polite and helpful.Breakfast is self service for continental breakfast, cereals etc and orders are taken for hot English breakfast. The food was of high standard and the staff were very good. I was able to leave my luggage in the hotel on my day of departure and collect it later, enabling me to spend a further day in London without having to worry about storage of luggage. An excellent choice for a visit to London

Reviews.Title: “Oasis off Oxford Street”
Reviews.Author: NickyCumbria
Reviews.Content: The unseasonably warm weather prompted a glass of cool ornge juice by the Reception team as I booked into the Mostyn Hotel for the first time. Very freindly and efficient, exceptionally clean and the location is so convenient. My room was quite spacious, and again very clean indeed. A few minutes walk to the retail offers on Oxford Street and a few minutes to the Marble Arch tube on the Central line so the Mostyn is well placed for all the London attractions. The menu looked excellent though I was attending a function so didn't have dinner there. Wouldn't hesitate to recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “very convenient location”
Reviews.Author: Anuja_15
Reviews.Content: located just behind the thistle (1 min walk onto primark on oxford street) and a 5 mins walk to marble arch. location is ideal for london! rooms were neat and clean, though tiny like most of central london. We booked a double room for GBP 180. Tip: the rooms in the basement are more spacious for the same price, if you dont have issues with no sunlight/ windows not opening! the rooms on the higher floors are good only for 1 person, so we upgraded to a family room on the second floor with a charge of GBP 45, which was ok. they do show you the room options available, if you request. staff was very friendly and internet was free. we didnt eat at the hotel as oxford street is like 1 min away. coffee/tea maker provided complimentary in the room. would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff & excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: D L K
Reviews.Content: We just spent 6 nights at the Mostyn Hotel and were very pleased with our experience. Travelling with my wife and in-laws, we were taken care of by the entire staff . . . in the dining room for breakfast, the lounge for a drink or tea, making arrangement for taxi or other transportation to events or outings. The rooms were a wee bit smaller than Canadian standards, but very functional and newly renovated and the beds were extremely comfortable. One suggestion . . . bring ear plus, as the hotel sits on a busy intersection. We were within walking distance to buses, subway (underground) wide variety of restaurants, shopping and sightseeing buses. Only a short taxi ride to theatres, train stations and of course . . . . . Buckingham Palace. Al in all . . very pleased with the experience . . . and the cost was very reasonable, especially with breakfast as a part of the package. DLK Sudbury, Ontario, Canada

Reviews.Title: “location is great, accomodation is really poor”
Reviews.Author: manpoloman m
Reviews.Content: i stayed 2 nights - price 560 gbp with vat ... i have booked club-single room but i got a room looks like student room... receptionist offered me, that i can move to better room next day (bcoz all better room "was full" , but he didn t gave me any discount...here is my opinion, location 9/10, room 2/10 (you cant open window,no mini bar in my room, bathroom was so small, that i can hardly turn around, hard bath towels, LCD/Plasma screen had bad or no signal), cleanliness 2/10, breakfast 2/10... i am sorry i can not say anything positive except location... for these high prices next time i ll find much better hotel

Reviews.Title: “Great central London Hotel”
Reviews.Author: cmercier66
Reviews.Content: Very helpful staff, great central location (great for shopping), not as noisy as i would imagine (behind Oxford street). My room was big, the baby bed was requested and provided, the room was clean. The breakfast was a bit poor unfortunately.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to go back!”
Reviews.Author: AllyUK_11
Reviews.Content: A gem of a hotel. Excellent location. The staff are all very friendly and go out of their way to make your stay as enjoyable as possible. Food is excellent. The bar is lovely and the drinks are reasonably priced. The Three Tuns is across the road and is the best pub in London.

Reviews.Title: “best hotel stay in ages”
Reviews.Author: 808JSmith
Reviews.Content: We checked in just before lunch and found our room was ready for us to go to. Our room, an executive twin, was larger then we had expected and had more than enough space for the two of us. Everything was very clean especially the bathroom and the shower was a delight. The staff at the hotel were wonderful. They always looked genuinely pleased to see you. Breakfast was great. We had a choice of all the fresh fruit and cereals, cold meats and cheeses, danish pastries and of course a full English. The waiters and waitresses couldn't do enough for you. However they did seem a little disorganized when it came to who was waiting on which table as we were repeatedly asked had we ordered toast or tea/coffee etc. We didn't mind though! The location of the hotel was great. We were just a few steps off from Oxford St where you could catch several buses or Marble Arch Tube was just 5mins away. As the hotel was situated on a one way street we found that many of our return bus trips took us to one of two bus stops directly outside the hotel. After a tiring day round London this was ideal. We also discovered that the number 30 bus took us from the hotel straight to Kings Cross station and saved us Â£15! I would certainly go back to this hotel and look forward to planning my next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Very small rooms”
Reviews.Author: Bradharris
Reviews.Content: The hotel is centrally locate but the service isn't good and the rooms are very small. beside the location I woul dn't choose this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing start”
Reviews.Author: AberdeenScotlandAnna
Reviews.Content: This hotel was booked well ahead but on our arrival at 19.20 our room was not ready. After a phone call to housekeeping the receptionist said it would mean a five minute wait. After a long journey we were not pleased. He was quite snippy with us and told us 'Well five minutes is not a long time'. He did not apologise or offer us coffee which we got for ourselves from the bar. Not a very welcoming start. Our room was well appointed if small and breakfast was excellent. The interior of this hotel from reception to room was very claustrophobic and warren like with very narrow, dark corridors and only one small lift. Good location though but apart from the charming staff member who looked after our cases on our last day the staff did not effuse friendliness or warmth. Would have been charged Â£10 to check in online for a flight!

Reviews.Title: “Clean and comfortable, but pricey”
Reviews.Author: norfolkwebby
Reviews.Content: I paid an extra Â£60 for an upgraded room and was assured they were bigger than what i had originally booked. However, upon arriving the Club room was tiny. So tiny i was unable to sit on the chair in front of the mirror as there wasnt enough space to pull it out fully as it was blocked by the bed. The bathroom was also very very small and disappointing considering of how much the stay cost me. However the room was very clean and the bed was comfortable. Location is perfect if you want shopping on Oxford Street but not so good if you would rather spend the time walking round Piccadilly, Leicester Square and Covent Garden. The staff weren't very friendly and didn't make me feel very welcome. The lady serving behind the bar had a streaming cold and was using tissues to blow her nose but then didnt wash her hands afterwards. Its a nice enough hotel, but i probably wouldn't stay there again as i feel i was mis-sold the upgrade. Only one lift for the whole building, and was not impressed when i waited for the lift and when it finally arrived i was greeted by a staff member with suitcases who told me it would be easier for me to use the stairs. I think he meant it would be easier for HIM so he didnt have to remove the cases to make room for me to use the lift. I felt that was very rude. I realise he was working, but i was not impressed by his attitude.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, excellent service”
Reviews.Author: ANON1953
Reviews.Content: Located just off west end of Oxford Street, 2 minutes from Marble Arch Underground station - excellent for shopping or shows, 30 minutes liesurely walk down Park Lane or through Hyde Park to Buckingham Palace/Knightsbridge.. Staff were very friendly and efficient. Food in the Fire and Ice Bistro was of an excellent qualiy and quantity [especially full english breakfast], bar/wine prices were reasonable. There was 15% discount on food/drink in Fire and Ice for hotel guests.Would stay there again if visiting London.

Reviews.Title: “we will return.”
Reviews.Author: 1rusty
Reviews.Content: having quickly arranged these 2 days in london,we wondered what to expect when we arrived at our hotel ? we found it to be more like a 5 star,fabulous staff,afternoon tea server very very pleasant, hotel so clean,bedrooms to die for,including marble bathroom,not noisy at all,we were in the middle of london ? shops and buckingham palace all in walking distance..what more could we have ask for ? maybe better weather !! thanks to all the staff..

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and accommodating”
Reviews.Author: kestep03650
Reviews.Content: Check in good. Original room small and noisy (traffic). When I complained the next day about not being able to sleep they moved me without any problem. The new room overlooked an internal courtyard and was very quiet. Bed very comfy, room spacious and clean. WiFi did not work during the stay had to use the cable, but it was free a nice surprise for the UK. Staff very friendly. Breakfast very good. Conference facilities OK not brilliant therefore overall score of 4 not 5. Room service food good but expensive for what it was.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel in the heart of London”
Reviews.Author: Backscratch
Reviews.Content: We went as a theatre break and found the hotel fantastic! You're right near Oxford street for all the shops and only a 2 minute walk to the nearest tube station (Marble Arch). if you're happy to walk, and we were, a brisk trot east takes to straight to soho, covent garden and theatre land in about 30 minutes, taking in all the shops and sites on the way! The hotel was clean and the staff friendly. Our room was modern and perfect for our needs. I would recommend getting a deal with breakfast included as we did because if you don't and you want to eat at the hotel the next morning a full English is Â£20!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay in the heart on London”
Reviews.Author: Love2Travel23073
Reviews.Content: Mostyn Hotel was one of the best hotelswe stayed in on our holiday. Staff were lovely (especially the porter) and happy to help in anyway they could. Rooms were small but thats what you expect, butthey certainly used the small space they had been given well. Bed was VERY comfy and aircon was welcomed on a hot summers day. Definatly have breakfast downstairs because its great value and yummy and they lady who supervisors is so welcoming. Will definatly return to Mostyn on our next trip to London.

Reviews.Title: “Bulk standard hotel”
Reviews.Author: BristolBaz
Reviews.Content: Air conditioned which was good as was very hot in July when stayed. Rooms as small but fine and well equipped. Location is excellent for what we wanted out of London (near Oxford St). Breakfast over priced so we went to serpentine in Hyde park.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent and central”
Reviews.Author: Ireneliath
Reviews.Content: This hotel is excellent. Ideal for shopaholics, as it is just off Oxford Street. Very close to tube. Service, breakfast, staff all excellent. Just wish I could have stayed longer! My only small gripe was that the tea/coffee making facilities were in a bottom drawer, and we didn't realise they were there until we were about to check out.

Reviews.Title: “Third time at Moystin, and always a pleasure !”
Reviews.Author: danielakorem
Reviews.Content: Every time in London we chose this hotel, for being clean, small and very good located. Of course the staff is not always the same, but nevertheless they are very helpful and knowledgeable. Especially I'd like to mention the concierges - Dani and his lookalike, sorry for not remembering his name - they gave us tips on bus routes, restaurants and shopping malls, and where always smiling and ready to help. Also I'd like to thank Monika and her colleagues at the reception, who kindly helped us with the check in for our airline, and the staff in the breakfast (which was excellent) room. We were 2 couples. We will highly recommend this hotel to all our friends, and the tip that I've received in this forum for booking through the BW site was excellent. We got a very good rate for our stays in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, let down by some of it's staff.”
Reviews.Author: irishroverCheshireUk
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, 3 minute walk from marble Arch tube station. Recently refurbished, cleanliness very good. Terrible bathroom...very small, fixed shower over the bath, no grab handle. Hooks on doors for hanging towels were useless & nowhere else to hang the towels except over the top of the door. Breakfast Â£20 per person, so we ate out...lots of good cafes nearby. Concierge/doormen excellent, very helpful & friendly. Our top complaint is about the housekeeping staff. Even when the 'do not disturb' sign was on, someone would come into the room, often 2 or 3 times in a day, whilst we were sleeping. Also the walls seemed very thin, so you could hear the staff shouting at each other up & down the corridors constantly. We mentioned these complaints at the front desk, but nothing changed. Disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: cindersBlackpool
Reviews.Content: This hotel was Fantastic highly recommended Super Location Oxford Street 1 minute to hotel Great room even though small very clean All the staff so friendly and helpful Great Stay Carol Frend

Reviews.Title: “"We would go back anytime"”
Reviews.Author: 186233david
Reviews.Content: Stayed for two nights in this hotel on second floor,room was an executive suite,not very big but adequate for two nights stay,the room was nicely furnished and to a high standard,the staff were all very friendly and attentive I would definitely go back ,the hotel is well placed for shopping and hyde park etc. The only downside was some traffic noise at night but you get this in most hotels in central london.

Reviews.Title: “comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Paul and Tammy
Reviews.Content: My wife and i have just returned from a 2 night break stopping at this hotel. We had an excutive room on the third floor. It was small but had everything in it and was comfortable.Although there was 2 of us stopping there was only one comfortable chair and another chair for use with the dressing table. The air conditioning was very welcome in the warm weather on the days that we stopped.. My wife and i found the double bed and pillows were excellent. If you suffer with bad bones as my wife does she found the bed excellent which is a first for her from a hotel bed. The breakfast was good and was just what you needed to start the day off in the busy city. On the second day the hotel was alot busier and at times you had to wait for the small lift and would often be full with 4 people in especially if they had cases with them. On the whole we had a very enoyable stay and the staff were very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “first class and professional service”
Reviews.Author: cattsUnitedKingdom
Reviews.Content: we stayed for a friend's birthday, and from the minute we arrived and our bags were taken in by the great concierge, we were so well looked after by everyone we met. the beds so comfortable, decor of rooms and bathrooms very good. and an effective and quiet air condition system. the service in the bar area very freindly and efficicent. Any request was dealt with promptly with a" nothing is too much trouble" attitute. The location at the top of oxford street was ideal for sopping and using the tube. My advice just go you won't be dissapointed. well done Best Western Mostyn

Reviews.Title: “WOW, this hotel is lovely!”
Reviews.Author: skyblue132
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with my sister on the 28th June and can honestly say that it exceeded all our expectations. The staff were very friendly and helpful and nothing was too much trouble. The room was'nt huge but had everything you could possibly need (and more!) with a lovely, comfy bed and crisp white sheets. Every area of the hotel is spotlessly clean with fresh flowers and seasonal decorations etc. If you choose to stay here you definately won't be disappointed. We'll be coming back as it's so close for shopping, Theatres and sightseeing

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for shopping on oxford street!!”
Reviews.Author: xGinax
Reviews.Content: We were extremely pleased with the location of this hotel, as we had easy access to the marble arch tube, oxford street and hyde park! The hotel itself wasnt much to look at from the outside, but inside was stunning! I loved the decor in our room, it was spacious with plenty of ammenities and most importantly a large comfy bed! :) Perfect!!

Reviews.Title: “We loved it”
Reviews.Author: dinan1
Reviews.Content: Very clean, good breakfast, helpful staff, good location, rooms on small side but beds were very comfortable

Reviews.Title: “A very nice hotel - in a superb location!”
Reviews.Author: SIS6260
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at this newly renovated hotel. The room decor and the bathroom were nice and modern. It was very clean, the beds were comfortable with good pillows and duvets, and the breakfast was good. The hotel is located only two minutes walk from Marble Arch tube station, there are several busroutes just around the corner, and you can walk to Oxford street in one minute. We have stayed at several hotels in London, and this was a very good deal in such a central location!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Personal Service Will Definately Be Back”
Reviews.Author: GaryW21
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Mostyn for three nights as part of our wedding anniversary celebrations. You are made to feel welcome from the moment you arrive thanks to the friendly concierge and efficient reception staff. The location is perfect for both shopping and sight seeing and is conveniently located by a secure car park in Bryanstone Street. The excellent breakfast ensures that you leave the hotel each moring ready for the day ahead. Well done to all the Mostyn staff.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely venue, excellent service, wonderful food!!”
Reviews.Author: ivangelder1971
Reviews.Content: I attended an event at the Mostyn on 14th May 2011. This was to celebrate my employers thirtieth year in business. I can honestly say that the team at the Mostyn made it very easy to organise an event through them and helped us every step of the way. I arrived early on the evening of the event, in case there were any last minute preparations, but the team had everything under control and so all i had to do was sit down and have a drink!! The Hotel itself is beautifully finished, modern yet not stark with wonderful chandeliers and marble floors. It has a lovely feel to it and i felt instantly at east being there. The evening went off without a hitch, all the staff were very friendly and helpful and the food (from Fire & Spice) was to die for. I would definately use the Mostyn for future events and would like to say a very big thank you to all of the management and staff for making it a very memorable evening for all who attended.

Reviews.Title: “SUPERB HOTEL, GREAT LOCATION, EXCELLENT STAFF”
Reviews.Author: Emma590
Reviews.Content: I attended a function on Saturday 14th May 2011 and must say what a lovely hotel the Mostyn is. When we arrived at the hotel the staff greeted us and made us feel most welcome. I loved the decor and wanted some of the pictures for myself. The food was incredible and wished I could have had a doggy bag. This hotel is a treasure and I would recommend it to anyone. Emma Cohen

Reviews.Title: “A gem of a business hotel”
Reviews.Author: balearicrazy
Reviews.Content: Have stayed at the Mostyn a couple of times for a total of 4 nights. Really nice hotel - basically has everything that you need from a business hotel and would also make a good leisure stop. Really well and proportioned rooms - not massive, but well lit, large comfortable king bed, good sized and clean bathroom with powerful shower. Stay at Marriott a lot as well, and I'd say this was the first BW I've stayed in that matched their usual quality, while been considerably cheaper! Air conditioning that actually works and can be controlled. Desk, safe etc as normal. Good internet access, and unusually for central London I found it to be pretty fast. Check in - really nice and professional check in staff. Lifts to all floors. Nice common areas, and a good bar area. Had dinner in the restaurant one night, little lacking in atmosphere, but good service and good food - including some healthy options. Breakfast is the best. Good selection of Continental, excellent table service from friendly staff and cooked breakfast to order including eggs as you like them - really enjoyed my Eggs Benedict! Check out, equally good. Very accommodating about storing a bag for me. Haven't used (yet), but there is also a gym on site apparently. Also, location is excellent for business and for leisure. Right on Central Line, and a , and loads of bus routes (inc direct to KX, Victoria, Stansted airport), right on Hyde Park and right on Oxford street! Wouldn't hesitate to recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - great accomodation”
Reviews.Author: MSP2010
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is great. It is just off Oxford Street and very close to the Marble Arch Tube station (3-4 min). The room (twin room) was very spacious and clean. Everything was new in the room (it must have been redecorated lately). The only disadvantage was that the room faced the street and there was a bit of noise early in the morning. We did not have breakfast at the hotel since it was very expensive Â£19.95/per day. But that was not a problen since there is a Costa Coffee just opposite the hotel and a Pret Ã¡ Manger next to the tube station. On in all it is a great hotel if you want to stay in the center of London. Very good for shopping as well. I will go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location, let down by details”
Reviews.Author: Rustedandrotten
Reviews.Content: The Mostyn on paper looks to be a great hotel and we were looking forward to our week long break expectantly. On arrival we confirmed that we had been given a quiet room, which we were told we had. We went through to find that we had a ground floor room right next to the main entrance which was on the main road directly opposite the taxi rank and smoking area for the Thistle Hotel, the noise was unbelievable as at that moment there was a bus load of noisy tourists decanting right under the window!! The window was completely obscured bar top 6" so no 'view'. So requested room change immediately and were put into another ground floor room described as 'overlooking the courtyard'. This was better as at least it was not onto the main road, but still obscured windows and it later became evident that we had an external staircase just outside with continuous crashing and banging of doors and other items going on through out the day and night, staff in and out of the restaurant door below all the time, irritating beyond belief!! The room was clean and well maintained, but was claustrophobic due to the lack of natural light and let down further by a very inconvenient and dangerous step across the room that led to more than one trip when the lights were out. Really we should have demanded a room to the standard expected, it seems that 'Executive' as now now described is third class whereas their new 'Club' is the real 4* Mostyn Hotel that was sold in the description. The restaurant service was excellent whilst the duty manager was present and this genleman was a real asset to the hotel, personable and helpful in every way, unfortunately as soon as he was on his day off, it all fell to pieces! Slow and unattentive service, shambolic clearing of tables and failure to deliver the correct meals as they had 'run out of basics'!! We were presented with one piece of bacon that looked like it had been rescued from the bin, cold, burnt baked beans and half a mushroom with a chunk missing, not very impressive. At this point we had waited over 45 minutes for this, and breakfast service still had an hour to run so heaven alone knows what others following us were presented with!! A complaint to the duty manager that evening lead to the restaurant manager apologising profusely the following day and everything back to slick and efficient, it is a shame that staff cannot be trusted to maintain the high standard that this poor unfortunate expects when he is not there. There is also an issue in that everything is a charged extra, ice cost Â£4-00, (free in most places we have visited!) lose the plastic room swipe card, Â£5-00, Â£10-00 to use the business centre and so on!! Staff do not have access to the internet so not possible to get them to do online check in for customers for airlines and print boarding cards. Lack of an important service! Free WiFi has to be renewed daily and was slow in the room we were located in, inconvenient. Maybe we were unlucky, but this was not what was expected from a 4* hotel, very expensive for a very mediocre experience, basically we felt ripped off as this was paid for from our own rather than a deep corporate pocket. The price has since escalated from when we booked 3 months ago and Â£1660 for the same stay can only be described as exorbitant!! Fair enough, you are paying for location, but there are many hotels in the area competing for business, advice would be to shop around!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Robins36
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, offers very good value for money. Make sure you get a rate inclusive of breakfast as if you don't a full English will set you back Â£19.95 each. Would really recommend this hotel & will certainly be staying again when in London!

Reviews.Title: “Love at first stay.”
Reviews.Author: Schleins Girl
Reviews.Content: I chose to stay at the hotel because of the location, it is very close to Selfridges and good shopping at Oxford Street. And i am going to stay there again. Our room was nice, loads of closet space, coffeemaker, bathtub and a flatscreen. The staff treated us like royalty. And a shoutout to the breakfast staff! They remembered what we had for breakfast the previous morning. Â£130, bed and breakfast. I'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “Bed Bug Found on Bed - Bad Check-in Experience”
Reviews.Author: tom1000x
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel on several occasions and have generally had a good experience, the location is excellent and the staff are very friendly. This month I stayed for 3 nights, after checking-in I was provided with a room on the 4th floor - the TV did not work so I called reception, however, while waiting for the hotel employee to take a look at the TV, I noticed a dead insect directly on top of the bed, a closer inspection and a phone search brought up a picture of a bed bug identical in every way to this insect. I informed the employee about the bed bug, which he confirmed it was, he promised to show it to the hotel manager right away. At this point I was thinking of leaving the hotel altogether, however, I decided to stay and was instead provided with a room on the 2nd floor - I additionally requested to speak to the manager about my concerns about the bed bug, however, the was not available. The duration of my stay was satisfactory, every day the room was not cleaned properly i.e. bathroom glasses not cleaned properly, bed not properly made (sheet just pulled over), used tea cups still left in the same position from the day before. At no point during my stay did the manager seek me out to apologise for the inconvenience, disruption and bad experience I had. It was only after I had checked out of the hotel did I receive a call from the Assistant Manager apologising for the problems I experienced, however, adamantly denying that I had ever seen a bed bug at the hotel, this conversation was one-sided and at not point did I feel that the apology was sincere - I was not offered any discount or any other incentive to return to this hotel again. For what its worth I will not be staying at this hotel ever again and neither will any of my other family members who also stay here when in London. This hotel recently upgraded to a 4 star, including its prices, however, it needs to improve its standards of room cleaning and customer care.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money (if you can get a good deal!)”
Reviews.Author: MisterE_Hudds
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel direct with Best Western and got a really good deal - half price on both an Executive Family and Executive Double room. The family room was huge compared to all the other rooms we have stopped in in London, however, the double room was quite small (but adequate). Both rooms were really well furnished and comfortable. The family room had a very large king size bed and a sofa bed for the young one. This was not made up when we arrived, but a quick call to reception put that right. The bathroom was very light and modern with a rain-head shower and nice bath. The only annoying thing was the speaker that played sound from the TV. This was very loud and the volume could not be altered. In the end I removed the white lead from the back of the TV and this did the trick!! One tip I would give is to request a room that is not on the road side. My parents had a room that overlooked Portman Street and the traffic noise all through the night was really bad. This is probably due to the fact that there are roadworks on Oxford Street and the buses are diverted down Portman Street. The reception and bar area are very clean and tidy and the staff couldn't be more helpful. However, I wouldn't recommed room service - everything seemed to have a Â£4 delivery charge (including tap water and a glass of ice). We did not have breakfast in the hotel due to the price, so we ate breakfast in the nearby Weatherspoons before heading into town. The hotel is situated very near Marble Arch tube station which is handy should you wish to just use the Central Line. However, if you want to go anywhere other than the Oxford Street corridor you will have to change. Another little tip - don't automatically head towards the city to change tubes. If you go west and change at Notting Hill Gate for the District or Circle Lines it will be a lot quieter and you will probably get to where you need to go quicker. Marble Arch also seems to be where the buses converge, so consider taking a bus instead of tube, particularly if heading to Kensington/Hammersmith way. All in all, I would definitely go back to this hotel. Oh, by the way: if you are travelling to London by train, check out the daysoutguide website for some terrific 2 for 1 offers - we saved a fortune (eg: HMS Belfast, 2 adults and a child for Â£13)

HotelInfo.Name: BEST WESTERN PREMIER Mostyn Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 4 Bryanston Street | Marble Arch, London W1H 7BY, England
